title: Woman found dead in field, next to young child, may have been depressed: police
content:
SPENCER TOWNSHIP, MI -- A woman found dead in a Spencer Township field, with a 3-year-old suffering from hypothermia next to her, may have had postpartum depression, police said.
A 5-month-old child was found in a car seat in a running vehicle located nearby.
Authorities responded to Lincoln Lake Avenue and 18 Mile Road NE about 10:30 a.m. after walkers found the car parked off a two-track near a golf course. The area is in northern Kent County, about 30 miles northeast of Grand Rapids.
Police say the 27-year-old woman appeared to have died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head.
Related: Two young children spent night outside after mom's suspected suicide, police say
The 3-year-old was found partially on top of the woman. The girl was conscious, but she had a bullet or bullet-fragment lodged in her head.
The girl was flown by Aero Med helicopter to DeVos Children's Hospital in Grand Rapids.
Police think the child's wound may have been an unintended accidental consequence of the gunshot that killed the mother.
Police say the woman reportedly suffered from postpartum depression. Relatives reported her missing to Grand Rapids police about midnight Friday. She lived in Grand Rapids.
